title: Manager/Associate Director, Regulatory Affairs Biologicals
cleaned_text: Biologicals Description An expert or knowledgeable resource in all regulatory aspects of veterinary biologics for canine, feline, poultry, cattle, swine, bio-therapeutics, Veterinary Public Health, etc. S/He serves as the main regulatory contact for global R&D project teams, manufacturing sites, and for primary markets (US, EU, AU, NZ, CA, JP) to ensure new registrations, variations, geographic extensions, and licensed product stewardship in accordance with the company's global strategic objectives. Provides expertise for global product development in addition to correspondence and applications to the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) Centers for Veterinary Biologics (CVB), State authorities, and other regulatory authorities. Serves as a company government liaison for all USDA CVB correspondence and State Health Authorities; S/He represents the company during trade association meetings and US government sponsored meetings. Independently develops global regulatory strategy and ensures execution for pre-approval and post-approval activities for North America and other primary markets. This role provides leadership for guiding the company through complex regulatory paths through early research, product development and stewardship directly impacting sales. As an employee of Boehringer Ingelheim, you will actively contribute to the discovery, development and delivery of our products to our patients and customers. Our global presence provides opportunity for all employees to collaborate internationally, offering visibility and opportunity to directly contribute to the companies' success. We realize that our strength and competitive advantage lie with our people. We support our employees in a number of ways to foster a healthy working environment, meaningful work, diversity and inclusion, mobility, networking and work-life balance. Our competitive compensation and benefit programs reflect Boehringer Ingelheim's high regard for our employees. Duties & Responsibilities Manager Provides oversight for accurate submissions to health authorities required for new product registrations, licensed/permitted products, and licensed/permitted facilities to support life cycle management including product supply. Define requirements and strategy for new product registrations, licensed products and licensed manufacturing facilities. Assure accurate regulatory archives, databases, and company information management systems. Develop and assess effectiveness of regulatory processes required to comply with federal, state, and local regulations and in compliance with company policies. Develop relationships with federal and state agencies. Engage in development, interpretation, and implementation of legislation and guidance in alignment with company priorities. Negotiate on complex scientific topics. Represents RA on cross-function teams. Identifies potential issues, develops strategy, recommends actions, obtains RA management/team agreement, and executes. Communicates guidance/trends applicable to veterinary biologics, USDA facilities, R&D facilities, and projects along with impact reporting. Pro-actively escalates risks related to compliance, licensed products supply continuity, licensed facility risks, or R&D projects, to leadership with proposed mitigation strategies. AD Independently develop global regulatory strategies aligned to global business and R&D objectives. Guide execution by leveraging expertise, industry/company networks, and in-depth understanding of global regulatory requirements. Expert resource for global regulatory, R&D, and BU groups. Understand and communicate current and anticipated global regulatory environment and trends. Provide leadership/guidance/training within departments relative to regulatory strategy, execution, compliance, submission requirements, and project milestone inter-dependencies and timelines. Advise global and local new product development teams, manufacturing site leadership, Business Development, Commercial Operations on scientific/technical information for submissions for new product registrations, license product defense, claim extensions, and securing product supply or compliance. Partner with global regulatory teams to influence regulatory policy. Monitor global and local industry regulatory trends and work to inform the company of new requirements, guidelines, directives, and agency initiatives. Serve as a company liaison to USDA, state and local regulatory authorities. Provides leadership, coaching, training, and development to a group of regulatory professionals. Requirements Manager - DVM or PhD from an accredited institution, in area of biomedical sciences or related science, with at least three (3) years of experience in related industry - Master's degree from an accredited institution, in area of biomedical science or related science, with five (5) years of related industry or regulatory experience - Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution, in area of biomedical science other related science, with a minimum of eight (8) years of relevant industry or regulatory experience - In lieu of degree, ten (10) years of industry experience with five (5) years of relevant regulatory experience. - Must have knowledge and experience developing and successfully executing strategies in a regulated environment or the market impacted by veterinary biologics. - Demonstrated understanding of regulations and processes or related immunology/vaccinology concepts as they apply to vaccine development and registration and/or product maintenance. - Direct knowledge of regulatory requirements for demonstration of safety and effectiveness, including principals of study conduct, statistics and design preferred. - Does not hesitate to actively participate and provide regulatory assessments in meetings (internal and external). - Ability to formulate strategies for performing regulated activities related to veterinary vaccine development, registration, and life cycle management. - Willing to travel, both domestic and internationally up to ten percent (10%) of the time. AD - DVM or PhD in area of biomedical sciences or related science from an accredited institution including greater than eight (> 8) years of industry experience of which three (3) years to include interactions with Regulatory Authorities. - Master's degree from an accredited institution, in area of biomedical science or related science, with greater than ten (> 10) years of relevant industry experience of which five (5) years to include interactions with regulatory health authorities. - Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution, in area of biomedical science or related science, with a minimum of fifteen (15) years of relevant regulatory experience of which ten (10) years to include interactions with regulatory health authorities. - Regulatory experience supporting global teams with an understanding of international requirements and trends. - Experience with veterinary medicine related fields is preferred. - Direct knowledge of regulatory requirements including demonstration of safety & effectiveness, Chemistry Manufacturing and Controls/Outlines of Production/Section II of dossiers, including principals of GXP, study conduct, statistics and design. - Willing to travel, both domestic and internationally up to twenty (20%) percent of the time.
